messageBody:

>Subject: RE: [junit] TestCase Dependency Hierarchy

>
>
>> john.link@... wrote:
>> > Since other people's view was explicitly requested, here comes
>> > mine...
>
>> Just wanted to express my total agreement with Johannes and J.B.
>
>
>Darn, perhaps I should've said I wanted other views. ;-)

You got it.

>Seriously though, perhaps the question I should've posed to
>folks on this
>list is:
>
>What test runners do most ordinary folks [and not just the
>junit experts
>who've been using it for years] use most, do those runner primarily use
>collectors, and do suites add value to those runners?

I drive all of my junit tests from ant and I don't use suites. Every one of my unit tests stands alone and tests one functionality. I organise my tests so that they are in the same namespace as the thing being tested, and the ant junit task runs all of the tests in a specific package before moving on to another package.

>Like I said, I believe that for ant and eclipse, two user
>communities, I
>think the overall answer is no ... but I'd love to see some "market
>research".
>
>regards
>
>Adam

Simon
